none:
Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on May 09, 2017 Description from Terminal Escape:
A relic form the collection that inspired the birth of this blog, 54 Songs About Sport is....well, it's kinda exactly what it says is. 54 mostly sub-minute UK punk/post punk missives all somehow related to sports (plus four instrumentals). Insert MINUTEMEN, healthy doses of circa '83 Rough Trade and a serious lack of pretense, and you're left holding a brilliant collection.  54 SONGS ABOUT SPORT I wrote my source because I was curious - these were demos from the SPORTCHESTRA 101 Songs About Sport double LP that came out in the late '80s (how did I not know this existed? it's kinda brilliant, and also really good). A CHUMBAWUMBA related project, they sent this (incomplete) version to Dick because they wanted him to sing on a few tracks. Which he did. And the "MCH 88" on the spine? That mysterious punk petroglyph that has confused me for ages....? It just means that the tape was dubbed in March of 1988. Mystery: Solved. 
https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-AHyQZpaL_GQ/WRFcnfJTcfI/AAAAAAAAQ3s/bWAUAusNyKsK3iDDpTUM41gMBCdN_sGogCLcB/s1600/54%2BSongs%2BAbout%2BSport%2Bcopy.jpg

seo.title: 54 SONGS ABOUT SPORT - Terminal Escape
